intro: Cubeba capensis, commonly known as wild cubeba, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and undergrowth. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
